repo.description: The most widely used Python to C compiler
repo.name: cython

comment_data.body:
I think this file could do with an explanatory comment or two - it's really non obvious. Just to note that

1. You're testing the combination of passing command-line compiler directives and language level to make sure that language level is preserved.
2. The test is designed to fail when language_level isn't 3 due to fstring being unicode and str being ambiguous.

Other than that it looks good. I just think we won't be able to work out what the test was for in a year's time
Done. @da-woods if you don't mind I borrowed your description and put it in comment.

We don't need the explicit `None` here. And checking for `in` is faster than calling `.get()`, so let's reverse the order.
```suggestion
        if 'language_level' not in kw and directives.get('language_level'):
```
comment_data.diff_hunk:
@@ -651,7 +651,7 @@ def __init__(self, defaults=None, **kw):
             import warnings
             warnings.warn("C++ mode forced when in Pythran mode!")
             options['cplus'] = True
-        if 'language_level' in directives and 'language_level' not in kw:
+        if directives.get('language_level', None) and 'language_level' not in kw:

commit.message: Dont override langugage_level from directives when set to None

repo.description: The most widely used Python to C compiler
repo.name: cython

milestone.description:
Goals:
 New version scheme: 3.x instead of 0.x.
 Change default `language_level` from `2` to `3str`.
 Change default for `binding` directive from `False` to `True`.
 Fix some Python compatibility issues (if possible, allowing for breaking changes).

title: Dont override language_level from directives when set to None
